2. In Release Channel -- under settings If I choose to display the "Name Only" under Message List for address display format. It ignores

title: NNTP: Thunderbird not working with newly added newsgroup accounts
creator: grahamperrin
content:
My profile did previously work with news.eternal-september.org, although I very rarely used NNTP. The last active use might have been as long as July or August 2023.

A few days ago I added news.gmane.io, it did not appear in the sidebar.

news.eternal-september.org:

  • was originally in the sidebar, and responsive
  • is not in the sidebar after removing then re-adding the account.

Can anyone reproduce this issue?

Environment

Thunderbird 140.0.1 (64-bit) on Kubuntu 25.10. Neither Flatpak nor Snap; my configured software sources include packages.mozilla.org/apt/ for deb.

/etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d/packages.mozilla.org.asc exists.

The profile was previously used on FreeBSD 15.0-CURRENT, if that's relevant.

title: Thunderbird locks up whenever email is selected
creator: petermills2
content: I have Thunderbird 146.0.1 on a Win11 system, using POP. This setup has been in place from Windows 7, apart from the Thunderbird client version, and has worked up till the end of 2025. About October last year, I opened Thunderbird, and whenever I selected an email, or a number of emails, Thunderbird seems to get stuck trying to process something. The moving blue bar on the bottom right hand side of Thunderbird shows activity, but never stops. Taskmanager shows that Thunderbird is running, and that something is happening, but I cannot do anything with Thunderbird. I can only shutdown Thunderbird using Taskmanager. I have Norton AV installed, but I have turned it off, and the problem persists. I have removed all the emails from my inbox, and moved them to local files, and the problem persists. I have deleted and recreated my profile, and the problem persists. I have deleted the Thunderbird client and reinstalled it, and the problem persists. It doesn't matter if I select one, or twenty, emails, Thunderbird gets locked whilst processing something, and the problem persists. There is no issue with my Email provider, as I have checked using a webmail client. Emails are being processed and delivered from my email provider, and are received by Thunderbird. I would appreciate any suggestions as to the cause, or more importantly, a possible remedy. I have successfully used Thunderbird for many years, and I actively support them, so I am very keen to resolve this problem. Thank you in anticipation.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:146.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/146.0;os:Windows 11;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/profiling-thunderbird-performance"]

title: inloggen thunderbird
creator: dsadelange
content: Ik gebruik ThunderBird (TB) op Windows 11 computer. Ik heb een wachtwoord ingesteld voor de PC en een ander wachtwoord voor TB. De computer start zonder problemen op. Als ik vervolgens TB wil openen verschijnt een scherm waarin ik m'n wachtwoord moet opgeven. MAAR: als ik geen wachtwoord opgeef en een paar op annuleren klik, dan opent TB. Ik en ieder ander kan dus zonder wachtwoord mijn email inzien door op annuleren te klikken. Dat is natuurlijk niet de bedoeling. Is dit een fout in mijn instellingen die ik zelf kan herstellen? Zo ja, wat moet ik dan doen? Graag uw advies. met vriendelijke groeten BertdL
